intro: Stephanopodium longipedicellatum, commonly known as the long-pedicelled stephanopodium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered umbels of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. Its leaves are pinnately divided and often have a mild aromatic scent. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
